_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers
Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN

Ranger, Georgia (EPA ID: 100000036837)

Executive Summary



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

Allied Universal Corporation (AUC) accidental release risk management plan involves a unified approach that integrates technologies, procedures, and maintenance and management practices. The elements of the plan are intended to prevent and minimize the accidental releases of extremely hazardous substances used on site. The AUC facility emergency response program involves the preparation of response plans that are tailored to the facility and the emergency response services available in the community. AUC's emergency response program has incorporated EPA and OSHA Emergency Response Program requirements and is modeled after the "One Plan".



DESCRIPTION OF THE FACILITY AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED

Allied Universal Corporation repackages chlorine and sulfur dioxide into U.S. DOT specification cylinders and multi-unit tank car tanks (commonly known as ton containers).  In addition, Allied manufactures sodium hypochlorite and sodium bisulfite.  The facility includes a private sidetrack for unloading railcars. A production building, with an emergency scrubber, is used for packaging the cylinders and multi-unit tank car tanks. A room outside of the production building is used for sodium hypochlorite production and quality control testing.  Sodium bisulfite production operations are immediately adjacent to the aboveground storage tank farm, with a scrubber for the manufacturing process.  The chlorine and sulfur dioxide gas detection system as well as CCTV camera system continuously monitors all production and storage locations.  Based upon the program criteria as set forth in the Risk Management Rule, including EPA's definition of a "covered process", the chlorine and sulfur dioxide processes at this facility are subject to Program 3 planning.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

Th

e Allied accidental release prevention program is based on the following key elements:



a) Compliance with OSHA's Process Safety Management rule (29 CFR ?1910.119) and EPA's Risk Management Plan (40 CFR ?68),

b) Implementation of the National Association of Chemical Distributors Responsible DistributioN,

c) Operator Function Specific and Emergency Response Training,

d) Employee Hazardous Communication and Personal Protective Equipment Training,

e) Preventative maintenance schedule,

f) Use of Chlorine Institute and Compressed Gas Association recommended practices and equipment,

g) Use of effective operating procedures, written with the participation of the operators, facility managers and corporate managers,

h) Performance of a process hazard analysis,

i) Implementation of a three year program internal auditing program.



FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

No deaths, evacuations, recordable injuries and/or shelter in place do to a release of chlorine or sulfur dioxide in the last five years.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

The facility has an emergency response plan, which has been reviewed and updated in May 2013 (next scheduled update comprehensive review and update is 2019, emergency contact numbers and equipment listed in the plan were reviewed and updated in June 2018). The plan includes the following elements:

a) description of the covered process,

b) recommended first aid for chemical exposures,

c) a list of all emergency equipment onsite and where such equipment is located,

d) list of onsite and offsite emergency response personnel and contact numbers,

e) detailed description of company personnel,

f) emergency and non-emergency contact numbers,

g) procedures for reporting and handling the releases,

h) site and evacuation plans,

i) procedures for plan review and update as well as training requirements for emergency responders.
